official-title.#text:
To improve the efficiency of Federal Executive Boards to
		  enhance the coordination, economy, and effectiveness of Federal agency
		  activities, including emergency preparedness and continuity of operations, in
		  geographic areas outside the Washington, DC, metropolitan
		  area.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Oversight and Government
			 Reform

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Chapter 11 of title 5, United States Code

text.#text:
The
				purposes of this section are to—

strengthen the
				coordination of Government activities;

facilitate
				communication and collaboration on Federal emergency preparedness and
				continuity of operations for the Federal workforce in applicable geographic
				areas; and

provide stable
				funding for Federal Executive Boards.

In
				this section:

The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ; and

, in consultation with

				concentration of Federal employees outside the Washington, DC, metropolitan
				area to strengthen the management and administration of agency activities and
				coordination among local Federal officers to implement national initiatives in
				that geographic area.

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish Federal Executive Boards in
				geographic areas outside the Washington, DC, metropolitan area. Before
				establishing Federal Executive Boards that are not in existence on the date of
				enactment of this section, the

shall consult with the headquarters of
				appropriate agencies to determine the number and location of the Federal
				Executive Boards.

text.#text: The

Each
				Federal Executive Board for a geographic area shall consist of an appropriate
				senior officer for each agency in that geographic area. The appropriate senior
				officer may designate, by title of office, an alternate representative who
				shall attend meetings and otherwise represent the agency on the Federal
				Executive Board in the absence of the appropriate senior officer. An alternate
				representative shall be a senior officer in the agency.
